content: simple sock this is not a tutorial for someone who has never knitted a sock before but for anyone who already has more or less experience in knitting socks there is a small two-colour pattern in the transitions when changing colours so it is actually a sock design to use up wool scraps my example socks have 6 colours 64 stitches and resulted in a size 40/41 eu the pattern can easily be adapted to your own needs and preferences heel and toe too i recommend the increase heel for the heel as this keeps the stripes on the front side even materials monochrome wool scraps fingering or sport my example has 6 consumption on the last page under the picture needle needle of your choice tapestry needle gauge 32 sts and 44 row are 4´´ to 4´´ 10 cm to 10 cm in stockinette stitch chart black = colour with which 10 rounds have already been knitted withe = new colour for the next section abbreviations ws wrong side facing you rs right side facing you pm place marker r round m1l with left needle insert from front to back under the bar between stitches and place on left needle knit this through the back loop m1r with left needle insert from back to front under the bar between stitches and place on left needle knit this through the front loop ssk slip 1 stitch knitwise slip 1 stitch knitwise knit the two slipped stitches together through the back loops k2tog knit 2 together p2tog purl 2 together directions with colour 1 using a stretchy cast-on cast on 56 64 72 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist pm to indicate beginning of round *k2 p2* for 16 rounds cut yarn with colour 2 knit 10 rounds then take colour 2 and 3 and knit 4 rounds in the chart cut colour 2 with colour 3 knit 10 rounds then take colour 3 and 4 and knit 4 rounds in the chart cut colour 3 with colour 4 knit 10 rounds then take colour 4 and 5 and knit 4 rounds in the chart cut colour 4 with colour 5 knit 10 rounds then take colour 5 and 6 and knit 4 rounds in the chart cut colour 5 now it is time to start the increase heel r1 increase m1l and m1r are used for the increase of 2 stitches your choice where to start my recommendation is at the end of the round and to place markers before and after the increase r2 without increase in total 28 32 36 stitches are increased in 28 32 36 rounds continue the round pattern with chart accordingly also adjust the chart to the number of stitches heel turn begins on the back of the work with the increased stitches if you have placed markers these are the stitches in between r1 ws sl first purl 2 more than the middle of the increase stitches 15 17
